News.Title: Huhtamaki India Q4CY25 Results Call on Feb 13
News.Summary: Huhtamaki India Limited announces earnings conference call scheduled for February 13, 2026 at 3:30 PM IST to discuss Q4CY25 and FY25 unaudited financial results, hosted by ICICI Securities.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India Director Sami Pauni Resigns
News.Summary: Sami Pauni resigns as Non-Executive Non-Independent Director of Huhtamaki India Limited effective January 24, 2026, to pursue career opportunities outside the company.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India MD Dhananjay Salunkhe Steps Down
News.Summary: Dhananjay Salunkhe resigned as Managing Director of Huhtamaki India Limited effective January 15, 2026, after 3 years of service. Kamal Taneja will assume the role from January 16, 2026.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India Approves Key Board Appointments
News.Summary: Huhtamaki India Limited successfully passes postal ballot resolutions for three key director appointments, including Kamal Taneja as Managing Director and two Non-Executive Directors.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India Head of Sales GKA Resigns
News.Summary: Saurabh Kothari, Head of Sales GKA at Huhtamaki India Limited, resigned effective December 24, 2025, to pursue professional opportunities outside the company after nearly two decades with the organization.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India Seeks Shareholder Approval for Three Key Board Appointments via Postal Ballot
News.Summary: Huhtamaki India Limited has issued a postal ballot notice seeking shareholder approval for appointing Kamal Taneja as Managing Director for three years with remuneration up to Rs. 3.26 crores annually, and two Non-Executive Directors Axel Glade and Thomas Geust. The e-voting process runs from December 12, 2025 to January 10, 2026, with results to be announced by January 13, 2026, marking significant leadership changes for the packaging company.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India CFO Jagdish Agarwal Resigns After Four Years
News.Summary: Jagdish Agarwal has resigned from his position as Executive Director and Chief Financial Officer at Huhtamaki India Limited, with his last working day scheduled for December 1, 2025. The resignation follows a 90-day notice period after nearly four years with the organization, during which the company achieved significant milestones and built a strong finance team.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India Managing Director Dhananjay Salunkhe Resigns Due to Personal Reasons
News.Summary: Huhtamaki India Limited announced that Managing Director Dhananjay Salunkhe (DIN 09683886) has submitted his resignation due to personal reasons. His last working day with the company will be January 15, 2026. The company has informed stock exchanges BSE and NSE about this change in key managerial personnel.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India Reports Strong Q3 2025 Results with Double-Digit EBITDA and Improved Margins
News.Summary: Huhtamaki India Limited reported quarterly results with revenue of INR 6 billion, down 4.7% year-on-year but up 2.2% sequentially. Profit before tax surged 3.5x to INR 492 million compared to INR 143 million in Q3 2024. EBITDA exceeded 10% for the first time in four to five years, with EBIT reaching 8.6%. Net profit stood at INR 368 million versus INR 117 million in the previous year. The company achieved margin improvements through favorable sales mix and operational efficiency gains despite lower volumes. Blueloop recyclable products contributed 27-30% of sales. The company maintained strong liquidity with INR 1 billion ECB debt and deployed surplus cash in deposits and mutual funds yielding over 6%. CFO Jagdish Agarwal announced his departure by end of next month. Management expressed optimism about GST reforms potentially boosting FMCG demand and noted early signs of consumer upgrading to premium products.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India Targets Margin Enhancement Through Efficiency Improvements and Premium Packaging
News.Summary: Huhtamaki India plans to enhance margins through efficiency improvements and the introduction of new premium packaging solutions. The company aims to achieve steady volume growth as part of its strategic initiatives.

News.Title: Huhtamaki Reports Strong Q2 Profit Growth Despite Revenue Decline
News.Summary: Huhtamaki reported Q2 net profit of 368 million rupees, representing a significant increase from 117 million rupees in the same period last year. However, revenue decreased to 6.25 billion rupees from 6.5 billion rupees year-over-year. The company's EBITDA improved substantially to 555 million rupees compared to 181 million rupees previously, with EBITDA margin expanding to 8.88% from 2.77% year-over-year.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India Reports Q3 2025 Results and Appoints Axel Glade as Non-Executive Director
News.Summary: Huhtamaki India Limited announced its third quarter results with net sales of Rs. 6,049 million, representing a 4.7% decrease compared to the same period last year. However, the company achieved significant margin improvement with EBIT before exceptional items at Rs. 521 million, marking a 172.1% increase year-over-year. For the nine-month period, sales reached Rs. 17,899 million (down 3.2%) while EBIT before exceptional items rose 47% to Rs. 1,253 million. The company reported a profit of Rs. 367.7 million for the quarter and Rs. 878.6 million for nine months. Additionally, the Board appointed Mr. Axel Glade as Additional Non-Executive, Non-Independent Director, subject to shareholder approval. Glade brings over three decades of flexible packaging industry experience, having previously served as Executive Vice President at Constantia Flexibles. Managing Director Dhananjay Salunkhe attributed the margin improvements to favorable sales mix and cost efficiency programs across the value chain.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India CFO Jagdish Agarwal Resigns to Pursue External Opportunities
News.Summary: Huhtamaki India Limited announced that Jagdish Agarwal has resigned from his positions as Executive Director and Chief Financial Officer. The resignation is effective December 01, 2025, and Agarwal cited his decision to pursue professional opportunities outside the company. The announcement was made on September 09, 2025, and represents a change in the company's key managerial personnel and board composition.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India Reports Mixed Q2 2025 Results with Revenue Decline but Strong Margin Improvement
News.Summary: Huhtamaki India Limited reported quarterly results with revenue declining 4.7% year-on-year to ₹5.9 billion, impacted by subdued demand conditions, unseasonal rains, and inflationary pressures. However, the company demonstrated strong operational performance with EBITDA growing 28.7% to ₹493 million and EBIT increasing 37.4% to ₹362 million compared to the same period last year. The improvement was driven by cost control measures and operational efficiencies under their World Class Operations program. Net profit stood at ₹249 million with EPS of ₹3.30. The company's blueloop sustainable packaging solutions contributed 27-30% of revenue. Management noted mixed market conditions with urban demand remaining weak while rural demand provided some support. Working capital position was less favorable due to increased inventory and receivables. The company maintains focus on sustainable packaging solutions, operational excellence, and serving both domestic and export markets, with exports accounting for approximately one-third of total revenue.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India Reports Mixed Q2 2025 Results with Lower Sales but Improved Margins
News.Summary: Huhtamaki India reported net sales of ₹5,919.4 million for Q2 2025, down 4.7% year-over-year from ₹6,209.8 million in Q2 2024, impacted by lower volumes. However, EBITDA increased 28.7% to ₹492.7 million with margins improving to 8.3% from 6.2% in the previous year, supported by favorable sales mix and higher gross margins. EBIT rose 37.4% to ₹361.8 million. Profit before tax (excluding exceptional items) increased 55.2% to ₹331.2 million, while earnings per share grew 56.1% to ₹3.27. The company maintains a debt-free position with ₹1,557 million in cash and equivalents, plus ₹1,250 million in liquid mutual fund investments. Finance costs declined 38.7% due to lower borrowing. For H1 2025, net sales decreased 2.4% to ₹11,849.8 million while EBITDA grew 13% to ₹990 million. The company continues efficiency improvement programs and has achieved Zero Liquid Discharge status at multiple sites including Khopoli, Rudrapur, and Silvassa.

News.Title: Huhtamaki Q1 Net Profit Drops 35% to 249M Rupees Despite EBITDA Growth
News.Summary: Huhtamaki reported Q1 net profit of 249 million rupees, down from 385 million rupees in the same period last year. Revenue declined to 6.1 billion rupees from 6.4 billion rupees year-over-year. The company recorded an exceptional item of 295 million rupees during the quarter. Profit before tax increased to 331 million rupees from 213 million rupees. EBITDA grew to 426 million rupees from 320 million rupees, with EBITDA margin improving to 6.96% from 5% in the previous year.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India Reports 4.7% Revenue Decline But 37.4% EBIT Growth in Q2 2025
News.Summary: Huhtamaki India Limited announced its second quarter results for the period ended June 30, 2025. The company reported net sales of Rs. 5,919 million, representing a 4.7% decrease compared to the same period last year. However, EBIT before exceptional items increased significantly by 37.4% to Rs. 362 million. For the half-year period, net sales were Rs. 11,850 million (down 2.4% year-on-year), while EBIT before exceptional items grew 10.7% to Rs. 733 million. The company's EBIT margin improved to 6.1% in Q2 2025 compared to 4.2% in Q2 2024. Managing Director Dhananjay Salunkhe attributed the performance to slightly lower volumes but noted steady operational improvements and favorable sales mix. The company reported a net profit of Rs. 249.4 million for the quarter and Rs. 510.9 million for the half-year. Earnings per share for the quarter stood at Rs. 3.30.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India Schedules Earnings Call for Q2 2025 Results Discussion
News.Summary: Huhtamaki India Limited will host an earnings conference call on Friday, July 25, 2025, at 3:30 p.m. IST to discuss the unaudited financial results for the second quarter ended June 30, 2025. The call will be represented by Managing Director Dhananjay Salunkhe and Executive Director and CFO Jagdish Agarwal. The conference call is open to investors and analysts, with registration details and contact information provided through ICICI Securities as the call coordinator.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India Denies Speculative Acquisition Report
News.Summary: Huhtamaki India has issued a statement refuting a news article that claimed the company had plans for a potential $500 million acquisition. The company asserts that the information in the article is speculative.

News.Title: Huhtamaki Reports Q4 2023 Financial Results
News.Summary: Huhtamaki announced its Q4 financial results. Net profit was 261.5 million rupees, slightly up from 260 million rupees year-over-year, and significantly higher than 116.9 million rupees quarter-over-quarter. Revenue remained stable at 6.1 billion rupees compared to the same quarter last year. The company reported an exceptional item of 6.7 million rupees. Profit before tax (PBT) decreased to 340.5 million rupees from 350.8 million rupees in the previous year.

News.Title: Huhtamaki Reports Q4 2023 Financial Results
News.Summary: Huhtamaki has released its Q4 2023 financial results. The company reported revenue of 6.1 billion rupees, unchanged year-over-year. Net profit slightly increased to 261.5 million rupees from 260 million rupees in the previous year. EBITDA saw a significant rise to 3.87 billion rupees, up from 411 million rupees, with EBITDA margin decreasing slightly to 6.35% from 6.73%. The company also reported an exceptional item of 6.7 million rupees and a decrease in profit before tax to 340.5 million rupees from 350.8 million rupees year-over-year.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India to Consider Q4 Results on April 22
News.Summary: Huhtamaki India Limited has announced that it will consider and approve its financial results for the fourth quarter on April 22. This announcement indicates the company is preparing to disclose its performance for the latest financial period.

News.Title: Huhtamaki Reports Q3 Financial Results and Declares Dividend
News.Summary: Huhtamaki announced its Q3 financial results. The company reported a net profit of 117 million rupees, which is lower compared to 3.27 billion rupees in the same quarter last year. However, it remains stable compared to the previous quarter. Revenue for Q3 stood at 6.2 billion rupees, showing a slight increase from 6 billion rupees year-over-year. Additionally, Huhtamaki declared a dividend of 2 rupees per share.

News.Title: Huhtamaki Declares Dividend of 2 Rupees Per Share
News.Summary: Huhtamaki has announced a dividend distribution of 2 rupees per share for its shareholders. This corporate action reflects the company's decision to return value to its investors through a cash dividend payment.

News.Title: Huhtamaki Reports Significant Decline in Q3 EBITDA and Margin
News.Summary: Huhtamaki, a global packaging company, has reported a substantial decrease in its third-quarter financial performance. The company's EBITDA (Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, and Amortization) fell to 262 million rupees from 578 million rupees in the same quarter of the previous year. Additionally, the EBITDA margin dropped to 4.23% from 9.57% year-over-year, indicating a significant reduction in profitability.

News.Title: Huhtamaki Reports Q3 Financial Results
News.Summary: Huhtamaki has announced its Q3 financial results. The company's net profit for the quarter stands at 117 million rupees, showing a significant year-over-year decrease from 3.27 billion rupees in the same quarter last year. However, the net profit remains stable compared to the previous quarter. Revenue for Q3 is reported at 6.2 billion rupees, slightly up from 6 billion rupees in the same period last year.

News.Title: Huhtamaki India: Unveils Recycling Guidelines for Flexible Packaging
News.Summary: Huhtamaki India hosted Think Circle event, launching Design for Recycling Guidance for Films and Flexible Packaging. The initiative aims to tackle India's flexible packaging waste crisis by promoting recyclable designs. Industry leaders discussed circularity in packaging, emphasizing collaboration and improved recycling infrastructure.

News.Title: Huhtamaki Reports Q2 Revenue of 6.5 Billion Rupees
News.Summary: Huhtamaki, a global packaging company, has announced its second quarter revenue of 6.5 billion rupees. This figure represents a slight decrease compared to the same period last year, which saw revenue of 6.6 billion rupees.
